newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian Airlines unit's board resigns.
newsitem.headline: Canadian Airlines unit's board resigns.

text.p: The board of directors of struggling Canadian Airlines Corp.'s operating company, Canadian Airlines International Ltd., resigned on Friday at the recommendation of legal counsel, the parent company said.
Canadian Airlines Corp. said the resignations reflected the directors' concern about growing personal liability to the airline's creditors.
The board of Canadian Airlines Corp. remains unchanged, the company said.
The airline has asked its unionized employees to take a 10 percent wage cut as part of a survival plan to save the company, the smaller of two national airlines in Canada.

"Notwithstanding this event, I believe that the company and its unions are very focused on solving the issues facing us. Wednesday's discussions with unions raised a number of ideas which are being evaluated and meetings will continue within a week," President Kevin Benson said in a statement.

Until a new board is appointed, the affairs of CAI will be directed by its shareholders, Canadian Airlines Corp. and Aurora Airline Investments Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of AMR Corp., parent of American Airlines.
Fort Worth, Texas-based AMR has a 33 percent ownership interest and 25 percent voting interest in CAI.
